title: Minimum Cost Climbing Stairs
prompt:
You are given a cost array where cost[i] is the cost of step i. Once you pay the cost, you can climb either one or two steps.

Return the minimum cost to reach the top of the floor. You can start from step 0 or step 1.
constraintQuestions: Can the array be empty? (Yes, return 0.)
Can we start at step 0 or step 1? (Yes.)
Do we pay a cost for the top step? (No.)
Is the top one step past the last index? (Yes.)

walkthrough.title: Recurrence
walkthrough.body:
Let dp[i] be the minimum cost to reach step i. Then dp[i] = cost[i] + min(dp[i-1], dp[i-2]).
The answer is min(dp[n-1], dp[n-2]) since you can finish from either of the last two steps.

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (bottom-up, O(1) space)
Complexity
walkthrough.body:
Time: O(n) for one pass.
Space: O(1) extra space.
